New York City has followed up the High Line with the Lowline – an underground version of the city's High Line park. 
The Lowline is the city's first underground park located below Delancey Street on Manhattan's Lower East Side. 
The plan is to turn an abandoned trolley terminal there into a public green space using special technology that pipes in sunlight beneath the street's surface. DARREN ORNITZ 
Visitors at the Lowline Lab opening weekend in Manhattan, New York, October 17, 2015.
